patterns: What can you do for me
responses: I can inform you on: a) membership rules, b) the time and location in which our center operates, c) types of available group fitness classes, d) how to book or cancel a group class, e) contact details to our managers. I answer FAQs and can also describe to you different types of exercises and gym equipment if you name any.

patterns: How do I cancel my membership?
How to terminate the membership agreement?
How to withdra from the membership agreement?
responses: We hate to see you go! But if you must,the process is easy. You can fill out a cancellation form at the front desk of your home club, or send a letter (preferably via certified mail) to your club requesting cancellation. Memberships can't, unfortunately, be cancelled by email or phone. Please remember that your cancellation request is subject to any obligations of your membership agreement.No notice period is necessary on flexible monthly direct debit memberships. Once you have contacted your bank and cancelled the direct debit that funds your membership, your membership will be terminated immediately.

patterns: How do I upgrade my membership?

responses: Upgrading your membership has never been faster or easier. You can do it all online simply by visiting https://www.gymsharks/membershipupgrade. Or,stop by the club and our front desk staff can do it for you.

If the club is open, your best source of billing or membership information is to contact them directly. If your club is closed, please contact our Member Services Department (MSD@gymshark.com). Please note that the Member Services Department is open Monday through Friday from 9am - 6pm,CES. They will respond to your inquiry as soon as possible.

Gymshark Fitness really does charge as low as $35 dollars per month and up to as high as $45.00 for a Black Card membership (billing all members on the 17th of every month). On top of that,you will be billed $39 for the annual fee.

patterns: How old do I need to be?
Do you have any offer for seniors?
Do you have any offer for seniors?
responses: Our services and classes are tailored to various age groups: teenagers, adults and seniors. Since, irrespective of age, safety of our guests is of utmost importance, sports lovers below 18 need to submit parents' consent to join our club.
We're all for people expressing themselves, but do ask that clothing that may be perceived as intimidating, revealing, or offensive not be worn in the club.
We  do not recommend clothing that may present safety hazards or damage equipment.
Examples of clothing that is not allowed include: open-toed shoes or sandals, mud-caked, greasy, or soiled shoes or clothing.

patterns: Are my kids allowed in the club while I’m working out?
responses: In order to keep our membership services at the highest level, we do offer childcare services, i.e. kids room available within 10am-5pm.

patterns: What group classes do you offer?
What classes can you recommend for me?
Can you list and describe the classes available in your club?
What fitness classes do you offer?
What group classes can you recommend?
responses: We offer yoga, full body fusion, circuit training, HIIT, water aerobics, cycling, kickboxing and zumba. If you would like me to explain to you what each type means, please type in the classes name.

patterns: can I order a personal training?
I want to have a personal trainer.
responses: Professional Personal Trainers conduct our free Gym Intro sessions. This provides an opportunity to get instruction on a basic starter programme, meet team members and book a follow up free 30-minute personal training session.

Our offer includes yoga. The exercise itself consists of deliberate, concentrated movements and postures designed to promote flexibility, tone and strengthen muscles and align the body. Most often, breathing techniques are also encompassed along with the movements, allowing participants a relaxing experience coinciding with the movement.

patterns: Do you have Total Body Workout?
responses: Our offer includes FULL BODY FUSION. This is a healthy mix of strength-training paired with cardio and pilates.

Circuit training classes are typically an interval-style, fast paced, shorter routine that does exactly as its name implies - training exercises that complete a circuit. Normally in this class setting, you complete one exercise (usually in a station) for anywhere from 30 seconds to a minute, and then move on to the next station/exercise for another 30 seconds to a minute,usually with a brief break in the routine once you complete one full circuit.

HIIT stands for High-Intensity Interval Training, and is an exercise strategy that alternates short periods of intense exercise movements, followed by less intense, but still active recovery periods. The goal with a HIIT class is to reach a sustained target heart rate for exercise, allowing you to quickly burn fat in a brief amount of time.

Water aerobics can be a really fun way to engage muscle endurance and strength in a low-impact setting. This aerobic style class usually involves light dumbbells and movements designed to get your heart pumping at a steady, consistent pace.

patterns: I want to join cycling class
responses: A cycling class is great cardio workout that relies on a fitness center cycling machine,usually in a room designated for this type of fitness class. Often times, the class includes fast-paced upbeat tracks to help build the heart rate at different intervals over the course of the workout with alternating periods of sitting and standing, as well as adjusting the intensity or grade of the bike. Classes average around 45 minutes in length, and it's a great idea to bring a towel and water bottle with you to this class - you're going to need both!

patterns: I want to book a zumba class
responses: A Zumba class offers a series of energetic dance routines that provide a great cardio workout by mixing low intensity and high intensity moves for an interval-style,calorie burning,dance fitness party! The biggest key to joining a Zumba class is to not be worried about your dance moves,because everyone else is on the same boat!

Kickboxing is an adrenaline-pumping martial-arts style of fitness that provides a great cardiovascular workout and helps build endurance,coordination,tones muscles and core,all while working the heart and burning a lot of calories. In addition to all these great benefits,kickboxing classes also help with balance,flexibility and agility,and can even promote better self-defense.

patterns: what can I do to improve my health?

responses: a) exercise, b) do yoga and meditate, c) listen to music. For more detailed tips go to https://www.gymshark/healthline

patterns: what to do when someone forgets Login password?
responses: No worries! Please enter your email ,we will send a link to your email address.

patterns: If I sign up today can I work out?
How long do I have to wait until my membership is until?
responses: When you join you will receive immediate confirmation of your membership sent to your e-mail address. As soon as you are a member you can pop in and register your fingerprint, within 5 minutes you will be able to use the gym facilities.

patterns: Are there any other on site services?
responses: We offer other services such as beauty therapy, personal training and sports massage - perfect treats after exercising. You will find details and price lists for these services around the club and in our monthly newsletter.

patterns: do I need a padlock to open a locker?
responses: We provide lockers to store your clothes and valuables. These lockers are for use whilst you are within the club ONLY and storage is not available to you overnight or during the day whilst you are off site. You are welcome to bring a padlock with you but please make sure it has an 8mm shackle.

patterns: Can I put my membership on hold?
responses: We do not usually offer this facility. You must pay for your membership whether or not you use the gym. This is reflected in our moderate fees.

patterns: Have can I use your app?
How to login to your application?
do you have an online app?
responses: Our on-line facility and App are both quick and easy to use. You are able to book a Gym Intro, book classes, enquire about our personal trainers, look at your membership type, renew a paid in full membership. Please log in using the email and password you created when first joining.

patterns: Are there any student/group discounts available?
responses: We believe our prices are extremely competitive and are therefore non-negotiable! The prices listed under the 'Join Now' tab of the website are our set membership types.

patterns: How do I access online classes?
responses: Our online classes are broadcast live on Instagram. All our live Instagram workouts are saved to IGTV so you can go back and enjoy them in your own time - you don't have to follow them live.

patterns: What safety measures can I expect when you reopen?
responses: The gym will be fully operational and compliant with government regulations. In addition, every one of our locations will be adhering to our own, strict commitments for COVID-safety.

Every staff member and instructor have their temperature checked and recorded in our staff safety log before their shift. Staff is required to wear masks during their shift. We have also installed multiple hand sanitising stations around the club, including 2 motion-activated hand sanatisers which are located as soon as you enter the gym.

patterns: Do I have to book classes
responses: Classes can be booked through the Member Area on the website.The vast majority of our classes are included within your membership. These can be booked in the Member Area of the website.

patterns: do I have to bring my own mat?
responses: To see all our equipment, please go to https://www.gymequipment@gymshark.com

patterns: what can I buy at the club reception area?
responses: Yes, you can buy WHEY protein, protein shales and protein bars. Water is sold in the multiple vending machines at the club.

patterns: How will I maintain social distancing in the gym?
responses: Equipment is spaced 2m apart where possible. There is also clear signange around the gym to remind members to maintain social distancing.

patterns: I have a health issue, can I exercise?
responses: It will depend on your condition and medical clearance may need to be provided by your doctor.

patterns: Can I workout with a disability?
responses: We are a state-of-the-art fitness center that offers programs that empower people with disabilities. GYMSHARK has an area where wheelchair-using athletes can exchange their wheelchair for a sports wheelchair. They also feature locker rooms with wide doorways for easier navigation.
Yes, we offer personal adaptive trainings and consultations/sessions with our physiotherapist.
Our fitness classes are free for members and always have been. Once you join Gymsharkp, you can book any fitness class you like, free and unlimited.

patterns: What age do you need to be to join?
responses: Due to insurance reasons, you must be 16 years old before becoming a member. Outside of that, you’re welcome at any age - because you’re never too old to keep fit and active.

responses: Yes, every new member will receive a free induction session to show you how to use the equipment. We strongly recommend an induction if you have not been a member of a gym before.

patterns: Can I sunbathe at your club?
responses: Most of our gyms have sunbeds – please ask your receptionist for more details. Members must have reached the age of 18 to use our sunbeds.
Yes, we offer lots of free parking at Gymshark. Please ask in club for a parking permit/registration entry information to avoid charges.

patterns: How do I get into the gym?
responses: Simply enter the gym via the designated entrance, where you'll either be greeted by a receptionist.

patterns: Do you supply paper towel dispensers to wipe down equipment?
responses: Unlike other budget gyms we supply paper towels in each gym because we want to keep the gyms as tidy, as safe and as comfortable as possible. You can also rent a standard towel for an additional fee.
Our sites are staffed by PTs and a manager during daytime hours. Our 24hr sites use remotely monitored CCTV out of hours.
Please ensure members around you are aware. Please do not take photographs or videos on the premises or post remarks or imagery to the internet that could identify another Member
